page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY.BERWICK
page.content: Three quarters of the area surveyed is covered by the North Sea. Of the remaining three squares on the West,vertical edge of this block the central one covers the tidal estuary of the River Tweed. The area to the North of the river covers the Eastern extremity of Berwick upon Tweed and to the South lies Spittal. COASTLINE.This runs in a generally North South orientation >It is rocky to the North of the River Tweed and changes to a mixture of low cliffs and long,sandy beaches to the South. SPITTAL is an extended village which lies between the beach to the East and a railway embankment on a slope to the West which carries British Rail's East Coast railway line.
